Name: Action
Description: The action to perform. Example: RunInstances

Name: X-Amz-Algorithm
Description: The hash algorithm you use to create the request signature. Example: AWS4-HMAC-SHA256

Name: X-Amz-Credential
Description: The credential scope for the request, in the format access-key-ID/YYYYMMDD/region/service/aws4_request Example: AKIDEXAMPLE/20140707/us-east-1/ec2/aws4_request

Name: X-Amz-Date
Description: The date and time at which the request is signed, in the format YYYYMMDDThhmmssZ. The date must match the date that's included in the credential scope for the X-Amz-Credential parameter, or the date used in an Authorization header (see the note below the table). Example: 20140707T150456Z

Name: X-Amz-SignedHeaders
Description: The headers you are including as part of the request. At a minimum, you must include the host header. If you include an x-amz-date header in your request, you must include it in the list of signed headers. Example: content-type;host;user-agent

Name: X-Amz-Signature
Description: A signature derived from your secret access key. Example: ced6826de92d2bdeed8f846f0bf508e8559example

Name: X-Amz-Security-Token
Description: The temporary security token obtained through a call to AWS Security Token Service. Example: AQoEXAMPLEH4aoAH0gNCAPyJxz4BlCFFxWNE1OPTgk5TthT+FvwqnKwRcOIfrRh3c/L

Name: DryRun
Description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request. If you have the required permissions, the request returns DryRunOperation; otherwise, it returns UnauthorizedOperation.
